1.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
exile, concretely, prisoners; figuratively, a former state of prosperity
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine

2.brief: to grasp, i.e. collect
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a vale (i.e. broad depression)
Jehoshaphat, the name of six Israelites; also of a valley near Jerusalem
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to scatter, whether in enmity or bounty
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate

3.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, to handle, i.e. to throw, e.g. lots
properly, a pebble, i.e. a lot (small stones being used for that purpose); figuratively, a portion or destiny (as if determined by lot)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
something born, i.e. a lad or offspring

to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah)
to sell, literally (as merchandise, a daughter in marriage, into slavery), or figuratively (to surrender)

4.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Tsor, a place in Palestine
Tsidon, the name of a son of Canaan, and of a place in Palestine
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a circuit or region
Pelesheth, a region of Syria
treatment, i.e. an act (of good or ill); by implication, service or requital
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to treat a person (well or ill), i.e. benefit or requite; by implication (of toil), to ripen, i.e. (specifically) to wean
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
light; (by implication) rapid (also adverbial)
properly, a hurry; hence (adverbially) promptly
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
treatment, i.e. an act (of good or ill); by implication, service or requital
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)

5.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
delightful; hence, a delight, i.e. object of affection or desire

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a large public building, such as a palace or temple

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, a cord (as twisted), i.e. (by implication) a boundary; by extension the territory inclosed
